intro: Conophytum spirale, commonly known as the spiral conophytum, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its compact, rounded shape and fleshy leaves. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange during the summer months. Its leaves are often covered in a fine, white powdery coating, which helps reduce water loss. Conophytum spirale is well adapted to arid environments and requires minimal watering to thrive.
